item.title: Expert(e) sectoriel
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation à mi-parcours du Programme d'actions pilote pour le développement rural et l'agriculture en Algérie (PAP-ENPARD)

Objectif de l’évaluation

Une évaluation systématique et opportune de ses programmes et de ses activités est une priorité établie de la Commission européenne. L’évaluation se concentre sur l’analyse des réalisations, l’atteinte et la qualité des résultats de l’action, dans le contexte d’une politique de coopération en constante évolution, avec un accent de plus en plus marqué sur les approches orientées sur les résultats. De ce point de vue, les évaluateurs devraient trouver les preuves expliquant les raisons, les cas de figure et la manière dont ces résultats sont liés à l’intervention de l’UE et essayer d’identifier les facteurs générant ou entravant le progrès.

Les évaluateurs doivent fournir une explication des liens de cause à effet existant entre les intrants et les activités, et les extrants, les résultats et les impacts. Le travail des évaluateurs doit encourager la responsabilisation, la prise de décisions, l’apprentissage et la gestion.

Cette évaluation est principalement vouée à fournir aux services compétents de l’Union Européenne, aux parties prenantes intéressées :

  • une analyse globale et indépendante de la performance qu’a eu le PAP-ENPARD, en prêtant une attention particulière à ses résultats intermédiaires, en comparaison avec les objectifs fixés ;
  • des leçons et des recommandations, de manière à améliorer, le cas échéant, les actions présentes et futures.

En particulier, cette évaluation servira à proposer, le cas échéant, des mesures correctives en vue de la finalisation du programme prévue en décembre 2019 et de sa phase de clôture successive.

Les principaux utilisateurs de cette évaluation seront la Délégation de l'Union européenne en Algérie et la Coordination nationale du PAP-ENPARD.

Expert 2: Expert(e) sectoriel

Catégorie et durée de l'expérience équivalente Catégorie II, 6 ans

Formation:

Il/elle doit avoir un diplôme de niveau Master.

En l'absence de diplôme niveau Master, une expérience professionnelle additionnelle de 3 ans dans un ou plusieurs domaines d'intervention du programme (cfr. résultats du programme) est requise.

Expérience

Expérience professionnelle générale

Avoir au moins 6 ans et préférablement 9 ans d’expérience professionnelle dans un ou plusieurs domaines d'intervention du programme (cfr. résultats du programme).

Expérience professionnelle spécifique

Expérience considérée comme indispensable: -

  • Avoir une expérience confirmée dans la gestion des actions de développement dans les domaines d'intervention du programme: au moins cinq (5) interventions en lien avec les thèmes abordés par le programme (cfr. résultats du programme); -
  • Avoir participé à au moins deux (2) missions d’évaluation.

Expériences considérées comme des atouts supplémentaires: -

  • Avoir été membre d'une équipe d'assistance technique pour la mise en œuvre d'une politique nationale d'agriculture et/ou développement rural;
  • Avoir participé à des missions ou des projets portant sur les thématiques de la protection de l'environnement.

item.title: Expert 4 Expert in Design/ Implementation/ Evaluation of Development Cooperation Programmes (Cat III)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Evaluation of the Livelihoods and Food Security Trust Fund for Myanmar (LIFT)

Objectives of the evaluation:

Systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. The focus of evaluations is on the assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of Actions in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches and the contribution towards the implementation of the SDGs.

From this perspective, evaluations should look for evidence of why, whether or how these results are linked to the EU intervention and seek to identify the factors driving or hindering progress.

Evaluations should provide an understanding of the cause and effect links between: inputs and activities, and outputs, outcomes and impacts. Evaluations should serve accountability, decision making, learning and management purposes.

The main objectives of this mid-evaluation are to provide the relevant services of the European Union and the interested stakeholders with:

  • an overall independent assessment of the past performance of the Livelihoods and Food Security Trust Fund for Myanmar (LIFT), paying particular attention to its intermediate results measured against its expected objectives; and the reasons underpinning such results;
  • key lessons learned, conclusions and related recommendations in order to improve current and future Actions.

In particular, the evaluation of LIFT will inform the EU Delegation on the best possible approaches to maximise added-value, impact and effectiveness of future contributions to the sector on the basis of the following analyses:

  • Consistency, synergies and alignment of LIFT with government and donor policies and programmes in the sector.
  • Implementation progress of the programme against set targets.
  • Relevance and consistency of the LIFT Strategy 2014-2018, including the Theory of Change.
  • Relevance and efficiency of the logical framework for measuring the expected outcomes for the end beneficiaries.
  • Reliability and accuracy of annual target and achievement values of result indicators.
  • Coherence between contextual analysis and implementation mechanisms, including selection of activities and targeting of end beneficiaries.
  • Time and cost-efficiency of the contracting and implementation arrangements of the programme.
  • Transparency, accountability, efficiency and effectiveness of the governance and management mechanisms of the programme.

Expert 4 Expert in Design/Implementation/Evaluation of Development Cooperation Programmes (Cat III)

Qualifications and skills:

  • education at least University Degree in in field(s) related to agriculture, food security and rural development or, in its absence, equivalent professional experience of at least 1 year above the minimum general professional experience duration fixed below

General professional experience:

  • at least 3 years of proven experience in design, implementation and/or evaluation of development cooperation programmes

Specific professional experience:

  • at least 1 year of proven experience in evaluation of projects and/or programmes supporting rural development, agriculture or related fields in Myanmar

Soft skills:

  • proven quality reporting skills;

item.title: Technical Experts (x2) - (Cat III)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project:

Global objective

The overall objective of the programme, of which this contract is a part, is to prepare the Turkish Cypriot community for the implementation of the acquis communautaire in the sector of energy in general and in regard to energy efficiency, beginning with schools, in particular.

Specific objective(s)

  • To provide the Contracting Authority and the Beneficiary with a comprehensive assessment regarding the energy efficiency situation in 10 pilot schools (the list of the schools will be provided by the Beneficiary at the start of the assignment).

  • To provide the Contracting Authority and the Beneficiary with a clear and sustainable action plan for energy efficiency in the 10 pilot schools.

  • To assist the Contracting Authority and the Beneficiary in implementing the energy efficiency measures foreseen in the feasibility studies of the 10 schools.

  • To make specific recommendations for future support in the area of energy efficiency in schools in the Turkish Cypriot community based on the assessment of the situation in the pilot schools.

  • To increase awareness on energy efficiency in the schools and of relevant stakeholders such as professional chambers and local communities.

  • To increase skills in energy auditing of practitioners and consumers.

Requested Services

To conduct a comprehensive assessment of the situation in the 10 pilot schools including (but not limited to):

  • Carry out energy performance audits of the 10 schools and draft Energy Audit Reports. Data on energy consumption of the schools will be provided by the Beneficiary; however, their quality and format may not be fully reliable. Equipment to carry out the audits (infrared cameras, leak detectors, light meter, CO detector, etc.) will be provided by the contractor. It is expected that these tools will not be easily available for rent in Cyprus.

  • Assessment of current local procedures and tools for measuring energy consumption in buildings and provision of recommendations to improve it.

  • Review of implementation and effectiveness of applicable local requirements in the sector of energy efficiency in schools.

  • Prepare a Feasibility Study for measures to increase energy efficiency for each of the 10 schools (renovation/retrofitting strategies, smart metering, changes in behaviour, needs of awareness and training, etc.). The study will provide cost/benefit scenarios for different levels of increases in energy efficiency including analysis on equipment and human resources required to carry out the measures.

  • Identify training and capacity building needs within the 10 schools with a view to implementing energy efficiency practices (in accordance with best practices and the EU acquis communautaire).

  • Review other EU funded projects on energy efficiency in schools.

Experience and Qualifications required

Education (Minimum requirement):

  • A degree, preferably in a related field or, in its absence, 2 years of equivalent professional experience above the general professional experience duration fixed below (i.e. 3 + 2 = 5 years of general professional experience).

General Professional Experience (Minimum requirement):

  • At least 3 years of professional experience in the field of energy efficiency in buildings or energy audits in buildings.

  • At least 2 years of project management experience.

Recommended:

  • Knowledge of EU Directives and Regulations in the field of energy efficiency, including energy performance of buildings.

  • Experience in conducting energy audits of buildings is a strong advantage.

Language skills

  • Excellent command of written and spoken English.

  • Command of written and spoken Turkish is a strong advantage.

The overall objective of the programme, of which this contract is a part, is to prepare the Turkish Cypriot community for the implementation of the acquis communautaire in the sector of energy in general and in regard to energy efficiency, beginning with schools, in particular.

Specific objective(s)

  • To provide the Contracting Authority and the Beneficiary with a comprehensive assessment regarding the energy efficiency situation in 10 pilot schools (the list of the schools will be provided by the Beneficiary at the start of the assignment).

  • To provide the Contracting Authority and the Beneficiary with a clear and sustainable action plan for energy efficiency in the 10 pilot schools.

  • To assist the Contracting Authority and the Beneficiary in implementing the energy efficiency measures foreseen in the feasibility studies of the 10 schools.

  • To make specific recommendations for future support in the area of energy efficiency in schools in the Turkish Cypriot community based on the assessment of the situation in the pilot schools.

  • To increase awareness on energy efficiency in the schools and of relevant stakeholders such as professional chambers and local communities.

  • To increase skills in energy auditing of practitioners and consumers.

Requested Services

To conduct a comprehensive assessment of the situation in the 10 pilot schools including (but not limited to):

  • Carry out energy performance audits of the 10 schools and draft Energy Audit Reports. Equipment to carry out the audits (infrared cameras, leak detectors, light meter, CO detector, etc.) will be provided by the contractor. It is expected that these tools will not be easily available for rent in Cyprus.

  • Assessment of current local procedures and tools for measuring energy consumption in buildings and provision of recommendations to improve it.

  • Review of implementation and effectiveness of applicable local requirements in the sector of energy efficiency in schools.

  • Prepare a Feasibility Study for measures to increase energy efficiency for each of the 10 schools (renovation/retrofitting strategies, smart metering, changes in behaviour, needs of awareness and training, etc.). The study will provide cost/benefit scenarios for different levels of increases in energy efficiency including analysis on equipment and human resources required to carry out the measures.

  • Identify training and capacity building needs within the 10 schools with a view to implementing energy efficiency practices (in accordance with best practices and the EU acquis communautaire).

  • Review other EU funded projects on energy efficiency in schools.

Education (Minimum requirement):

  • At least 5 years of experience in identifying measures for retrofitting existing public buildings to increase energy performance and drafting related technical specifications.

Recommended:

  • Good knowledge of EU Directives and Regulations in the field of energy efficiency, including energy performance of buildings.

  • 5 years of professional experience as a Manager or Team Leader in implementing and/or managing energy efficiency in buildings programmes.

  • Experience with EU funded projects and applicable procurement rules (following the PRAG).

item.title: Evaluation Team: Expert II – Evaluation Expert (Cat II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project

Evaluation

Systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. The focus of evaluations is on the assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of Actions in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches. From this perspective, evaluations should look for evidence of why, whether or how these results are linked to the EU intervention and seek to identify the factors driving or hindering progress.

Evaluations should provide an understanding of the cause and effects links between inputs and activities, and outputs, outcomes and impacts. Evaluations should serve accountability, decision making, learning and management purposes.

The main objectives of this evaluation are to provide the relevant services of the European Union, the interested stakeholders and the wider public with:

  • an overall independent assessment of the past performance of the Agriculture for Development programme, paying particular attention to its results measured against its objectives;

  • key lessons and recommendations in order to improve current (BAFS) and future Actions. It should not only describe what has been achieved or what the Action contributed to achieve but particularly why and upon what conditions results have been achieved or not.

Requested Services

The evaluation will assess the Action using the five standard DAC evaluation criteria, namely: relevance, effectiveness, efficiency, sustainability and impact. In addition, the evaluation will assess two EU specific evaluation criteria:

  • the EU added value (the extent to which the Action adds benefits to what would have resulted from Member States' interventions only);

  • the coherence of the Action itself, with the EU strategy in Sierra Leone and with other EU policies and Member State Actions, and the agricultural programmes of the World Bank in Sierra Leone.

The evaluation team shall furthermore consider whether the following cross-cutting issues: gender equality, environmental sustainability and fostering of the private sector, were taken into account in the identification/formulation documents and the extent to which they have been reflected in the implementation of the Action and its monitoring.

The evaluation process will be carried out in three phases: An Inception Phase, a Field Phase, and a Synthesis Phase. Deliverables in the form of reports should be submitted at the end of the corresponding phases.

Experience and Qualifications required

Minimum requirements of the team:

  • At least one member of the team has sizeable experience in evaluation of agricultural policies and programmes/projects;

  • At least one member of the team: 7 years of experience in agricultural policies and governance, strategic planning, project design and institutional capacity building;

  • At least one member of the team: 3 years field experience in agricultural projects in West Africa, familiarity with Sierra Leone will be an asset;

  • At least one member of the team: knowledge and experience of the project cycle management of EU funded development aid modalities;

  • At least one team member: excellent oral and verbal communication skills in English;

Language skills of the team:

  • English

  • At least one team member: familiarity with one or more local languages is considered an asset.

item.title: Expert 3 – Cat III
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project

Global objective

The global objective of the programme, of which this contract is a part, is to enhance scientific literacy of the students at all levels of education in the Turkish Cypriot community via providing opportunity for laboratory experiences and to prepare them as the next generation of scientists, engineers and innovators with skills for enhanced employability and capacity for innovation.

Specific objective(s)

The specific objectives are:

  • To provide a comprehensive assessment of the science and/or specialised laboratory infrastructure of around 200 pre-primary, primary, secondary education and vocational education and training schools;

  • To identify the types of labs required for different levels of education and to categorise the schools under different lab types in order to be able to identify the necessary equipment, materials, software needs for the establishment of science and/or specialised labs and/or mobile mini-labs in the TCc; and

  • To make specific recommendations, in the form of a preparation of Technical Specifications or future EU support in the area of supplying science and/or specialised labs and/or mobile mini-labs, based on the findings from the assessment.

  • To provide recommendations on necessary structures for ensuring sustainability and effective utilisation and maintenance of the laboratories.

Experience and Qualifications required

Technical Expert with at least 3 years of professional experience in the education sector.

Education (Minimum requirement)

  • A degree in relevant fields such as science, education, pedagogy, social sciences, etc.

  • or, in its absence, 2 years of equivalent professional experience beyond the general professional experience duration fixed below (i.e. 3+2 = 5 years of professional experience in the education sector).

Professional Experience (Minimum requirement)

  • At least 3 years of professional experience in the education sector specifically in science teaching and learning (cumulative).

  • At least 2 years of professional experience in science laboratories and experiments.

  • At least 2 years of local experience in the education sector.

Recommended

  • Knowledge of education systems and policies of EU countries and ET2020.

Language skills

  • Excellent command of written and spoken English.
